info.title: Tradier Brokerage API
info.description: API for accessing Tradier brokerage services

get.description: Get the profile information for the current user

id.description: The unique ID assigned to the user

date_created.description: The date the account was created

day_trader.description: Whether the account is marked as a day trader

option_level.description: The option level approval for the account (1-4)

last_update_date.description: The date the account was last updated

get.description: Get the current account balance and margin information.

option_short_value.description: The value of short option positions

option_long_value.description: The value of long option positions

stock_long_value.description: The value of long stock positions

stock_short_value.description: The value of short stock positions

403.description: Access denied to the requested resource

404.description: The requested resource was not found

get.description: Get the historical account balances to track value over time

403.description: Access denied to the requested resource

404.description: The requested resource was not found

get.description: Get the current positions being held in an account

cost_basis.description: The cost basis of the position

date_acquired.description: The date the position was acquired

quantity.description: The quantity of the security (negative for short positions)

position.description: List of positions held in the account

403.description: Access denied to the requested resource

404.description: The requested resource was not found

get.description: Get historical activity for an account

symbol.description: The security symbol (for applicable event types)

quantity.description: The quantity involved in the event (for applicable event types)

price.description: The price per share/contract (for applicable event types)

amount.description: The total amount of the event

commission.description: Commission charged for the event (for applicable event types)

403.description: Access denied to the requested resource

404.description: The requested resource was not found

get.description: Get cost basis and gain/loss information for an account. This includes information for all closed positions. Cost basis information is updated through a nightly batch reconciliation process with our clearing firm

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Set a max number of number of positions to return

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort the results by specified field

close_date.description: The date the position was closed

cost.description: The cost basis of the position

open_date.description: The date the position was opened

proceeds.description: The proceeds from the closed position

403.description: Access denied to the requested resource

404.description: The requested resource was not found

get.description: Get all orders for an account. A single order will be returned as an obj/dict whereas multiple orders will be returned as an array/list.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination which is only useful for very large numbers of order broken into pages for faster retrieval

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of orders to return, 15 is defualt but you can set a high number such as 500 to retrieve all your orders in one call

create_date.description: The date the order was created

transaction_date.description: The date of the last transaction

403.description: Access denied to the requested resource

404.description: The requested resource was not found

post.description: Place a trading order. Supports equity, option, fractional, multileg, combo, OTO, OCO, and OTOCO order types.

type.description: The type of order to be placed. One of: market, limit, stop, stop_limit

price.description: The limit price (required for limit and stop_limit orders)

stop.description: The stop price (required for stop and stop_limit orders)

side.description: The side of the order. One of: buy, sell, sell_short, buy_to_cover

type.description: The type of order to be placed. One of: market, limit, stop, stop_limit

price.description: The limit price (required for limit and stop_limit orders)

stop.description: The stop price (required for stop and stop_limit orders)

side.description: The side of the order. One of: buy_to_open, buy_to_close, sell_to_open, sell_to_close

symbol.description: The underlying security symbol of the options

type.description: The type of order to be placed. One of: market, debit, credit, even

price.description: The limit price (required for debit and credit orders)

option_symbol[0].description: OCC option symbol of the option

side[0].description: The side of the option leg. One of: buy_to_open, buy_to_close, sell_to_open, sell_to_close

quantity[0].description: The number of contracts for the option leg

option_symbol[1].description: OCC option symbol of the option

side[1].description: The side of the option leg. One of: buy_to_open, buy_to_close, sell_to_open, sell_to_close

quantity[1].description: The number of contracts for the option leg

option_symbol[2].description: OCC option symbol of the option

side[2].description: The side of the option leg. One of: buy_to_open, buy_to_close, sell_to_open, sell_to_close

quantity[2].description: The number of contracts for the option leg

option_symbol[3].description: OCC option symbol of the option

side[3].description: The side of the option leg. One of: buy_to_open, buy_to_close, sell_to_open, sell_to_close

quantity[3].description: The number of contracts for the option leg

price.description: The limit price (required for debit and credit orders)

side[0].description: The side of the equity leg. One of: buy, buy_to_cover, sell, sell_short

quantity[0].description: The quantity of shares for the equity leg

option_symbol[1].description: OCC option symbol of the option

side[1].description: The side of the option leg. One of: buy_to_open, buy_to_close, sell_to_open, sell_to_close

quantity[1].description: The number of contracts for the option leg

option_symbol[2].description: OCC option symbol of the option

side[2].description: The side of the option leg. One of: buy_to_open, buy_to_close, sell_to_open, sell_to_close

quantity[2].description: The number of contracts for the option leg

duration.description: Time the order will remain active. One of: day, gtc, pre, post. For different durations per leg, duration can be specified as 0 indexed positions, ie duration[0]=day&duration[1]=gtc

quantity[0].description: The number of contracts for the option leg

type[0].description: The type of order to be placed. First order, one of: limit, stop, stop_limit

option_symbol[0].description: OCC option symbol of the option

side[0].description: The side of the leg. Equity orders, one of: buy, buy_to_cover, sell, sell_short Option orders, one of: buy_to_open, buy_to_close, sell_to_open, sell_to_close

price[0].description: Limit price. Required only for limit, stop_limit, debit and credit orders.

stop[0].description: Stop price. Required only for stop and stop_limit orders.

get.description: Get quotes for one or more symbols

last_volume.description: The volume of the last trade

trade_date.description: The date of the last trade (Unix timestamp)

bidexch.description: The exchange code for the bid

bid_date.description: The date of the bid (Unix timestamp)

askexch.description: The exchange code for the ask

ask_date.description: The date of the ask (Unix timestamp)

last_volume.description: The volume of the last trade

trade_date.description: The date of the last trade (Unix timestamp)

bidexch.description: The exchange code for the bid

bid_date.description: The date of the bid (Unix timestamp)

askexch.description: The exchange code for the ask

ask_date.description: The date of the ask (Unix timestamp)

post.description: Get quotes for a larger list of symbols

last_volume.description: The volume of the last trade

trade_date.description: The date of the last trade (Unix timestamp)

bidexch.description: The exchange code for the bid

bid_date.description: The date of the bid (Unix timestamp)

askexch.description: The exchange code for the ask

ask_date.description: The date of the ask (Unix timestamp)

trade_date.description: The date of the last trade (Unix timestamp)

askexch.description: The exchange code for the ask

ask_date.description: The date of the ask (Unix timestamp)

get.description: Get option chains for a specific underlying symbol and expiration date. Greek and IV data is included courtesy of ORATS. Please check out their APIs for more in-depth options data.

last_volume.description: The volume of the last trade

trade_date.description: The date of the last trade (Unix timestamp)

bidexch.description: The exchange code for the bid

bid_date.description: The date of the bid (Unix timestamp)

askexch.description: The exchange code for the ask

ask_date.description: The date of the ask (Unix timestamp)

get.description: Get available strike prices for a specific underlying symbol and expiration date
Get available expiration dates for a specific underlying symbol
Get all options symbols for the given underlying. This will include additional option roots (ex. SPXW, RUTW) if applicable.
Get all greeks in an option chain

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the greeks were last updated

get.summary: Get historical pricing for a security.
get.description: Get historical pricing for a specific security. This data will usually cover the entire lifetime of the company if sending reasonable start/end times. You can fetch historical pricing for options by passing the OCC option symbol (ex. AAPL220617C00270000) as the symbol.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start date for the data (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end date for the data (YYYY-MM-DD)

get.description: Time and Sales (timesales) is typically used for charting purposes. It captures pricing across a time slice at predefined intervals. Tick data is also available through this endpoint. This results in a very large data set for high-volume symbols, so the time slice needs to be much smaller to keep downloads time reasonable.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The start date/time for the data (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end date/time for the data (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM)

get.description: The ETB list contains securities that are able to be sold short with a Tradier Brokerage account. The list is quite comprehensive and can result in a long download response time.

Get the intraday market status. This call will change and return information pertaining to the current day. If programming logic on whether the market is open/closed  this API call should be used to determine the current state.

description.description: Description of the current market state

next_change.description: The time of the next state change (Unix timestamp)

get.description: Get the market calendar for current or a specific month
Search for securities by partial match on symbol or company name. Results are in descending order by average volume of the security. This can be used for simple search functions
Search for a symbol using the ticker symbol or partial symbol. Results are in descending order by average volume of the security. This can be used for simple search functions.

post.description: Create a session for streaming market data

url.description: The WebSocket URL for the streaming session

sessionid.description: The session ID for the streaming session

expires.description: The expiration time of the session

side[1].description: The side of the leg. Equity orders, one of: buy, buy_to_cover, sell, sell_short Option orders, one of: buy_to_open, buy_to_close, sell_to_open, sell_to_close

price[1].description: Limit price. Required only for limit, stop_limit, debit and credit orders.

stop[1].description: Stop price. Required only for stop and stop_limit orders.

symbol[2].description: The underlying security symbol, use for equities legs

option_symbol[2].description: OCC option symbol of the option, use for option legs

quantity[2].description: The number of contracts for the option leg

type[2].description: The type of order to be placed. Second order, one of: limit, stop, stop_limit

side[2].description: The side of the leg. Equity orders, one of: buy, buy_to_cover, sell, sell_short Option orders, one of: buy_to_open, buy_to_close, sell_to_open, sell_to_close

price[2].description: Limit price. Required only for limit, stop_limit, debit and credit orders.

stop[2].description: Stop price. Required only for stop and stop_limit orders.
